application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction by 2-3m to six Oaks (T1/2/3/4/5/6 on application) all within Area 1 on TPO 394
decision_conditions: The Oak trees are all situated within the rear garden of 9 Lowswood Close. As a group they have a high amenity value and significantly contribute to the arboricultural character of the Copse Wood Estate an Area of Special Local Character (ASLC). They provide a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in the Copse Wood estate and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR). The benefit in amenity and biodiversity afforded by the trees is both present and future because they have the potential for long life expectancies.

Previously we received a subsidence related tree works application for this address (54675/TRE/2004/89) however this was dismissed at appeal and the Secretary of State concluded "the damage is minor and associated with recent past building works at the rear and accepts the inspector's view that visual and photographic evidence points to an incident of ground heave, likely to have been associated with such works". Within the current appli
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
